meanings.sent1: His daredevilry in climbing the tall tree without any safety gear amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her daredevilry in trying to jump over the large gap was dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's daredevilry in stealing nuts from the bird feeder was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The daredevilry of the acrobat on the high wire left the audience breathless.
meanings.sent5: The daredevilry of the skateboarder attempting the risky trick was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The act of performing dangerous stunts or feats
meanings.sent1: The circus performer's daredevilry included walking on a tightrope without a safety net.
meanings.sent2: Watching the daredevilry of the motorcyclist jumping through fire hoops was thrilling.
meanings.sent3: The cat's daredevilry in leaping from the roof to the tree branch was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The daredevilry of the magician escaping from the locked box was truly magical.
meanings.sent5: The daredevilry of the stunt double in the movie was incredibly realistic.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in daring or risky activities
meanings.sent1: The famous daredevilry was known for his death-defying motorcycle jumps.
meanings.sent2: She admired the daredevilry of the skydiver who jumped from the plane without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's daredevilry in diving into the icy water was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The daredevilry of the explorer venturing into the unknown jungle was truly courageous.
meanings.sent5: The daredevilry of the firefighter rescuing people from the burning building was heroic.
